{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3710624,"name":"Bradley Chumanov","username":"NukeMinecart","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-12T01:34:06.072Z","cooked":"

badgerlog-logo-banner5583×2013 432 KB

Its called BadgerLog because alternative names sound worse and the logo would be less fun

BadgerLog is intended as a drop in replacement for SmartDashboard with additional features, most prominently being annotations on fields and support for NetworkTables 4 features.

The features of BadgerLog

  • Automatic key creation
    • Keys are created based off the field name and placed under a table with the class name
    • No more typing the String name of the key unless specifically needed
    • NetworkTable entries are created on boot instead of when they are first used
  • Automatic creation of NetworkTables entries from annotations
  • Support for any type with a mapping
  • Multiple methods for struct support
    • As a mapping (double or double array)
    • As a struct
    • As a collection of subtables
  • Units support
    • Unit conversions
    • Default units
  • Updates annotated fields by either publishing values to or getting values from NetworkTables
  • Buttons on NetworkTables
  • All SmartDashboard method implementations with advantages of: mappings, struct support, unit support, unit conversion.

BadgerLog is only a NetworkTables utility. It doesn’t do any kind of logging on its own. Its goal is to reduce the clutter of SmartDashboard methods, while also providing utilities to better utilize the NT4 API without its large complexity.

Comparison

Same functionality, reduced boilerplate. A more complete example of an elevator subsystem can be found here

SmartDashboard

smartdashboard-example981×503 77.4 KB

Native NetworkTables

native_example832×346 36.5 KB

Badgerlog

badgerlog-example599×387 44.4 KB

Installation

Java Installation

  1. Add a vendor dependency
    https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team1306/badger-log/master/vendordep.json

  2. Add annotationProcessor 'com.github.team1306:badger-log:2025.2.2.1' to dependencies in build.gradle

  3. Check out Getting Started on the wIki

Python and C++ implementations do not exist

Annotation Requirements

The annotation processor ensures that all fields annotated with @Entry meet the following criteria

  • Static
  • Non-final
  • Initialized and non-null

Links

Wiki
Javadoc
Github

team1306/badger-log: Effortless annotation-based Networktables utility","clicks":11},{"url":"https://github.com/team1306/badger-log/wiki","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Home · team1306/badger-log Wiki · GitHub","clicks":7},{"url":"https://github.com/team1306/badger-log/blob/master/test-project/src/main/java/frc/robot/comparison/BadgerLogCompare.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"badger-log/test-project/src/main/java/frc/robot/comparison/BadgerLogCompare.java at master · team1306/badger-log · GitHub","clicks":4},{"url":"https://javadoc.jitpack.io/com/github/team1306/badger-log/master-SNAPSHOT/javadoc/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Overview (lib master-15e0541d60-1 API)","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":15}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69694,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1306 Co-President"},"post_url":"/t/introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility/505205/1","custom_user_title":"1306 Co-President","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":15}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":15,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3710658,"name":"Banks T","username":"bankst","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bankst/{size}/172992_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-12T02:12:51.408Z","cooked":"

As 2974 has manually logged things using a thin wrapper around the NT API (or even just using it directly) the past few years, I like seeing more logging/dashboard libraries come around.
This is definitely simpler for basic logging and tuning than other options currently available.

However, looking at what this would take to integrate to past years’ robots, it seems like every item I have seen logged in the past would need to be changed to static as they’re all member variables. This would be a major change to most robot codebases I’ve seen, as the majority use member variables for everything except constants.

Was this limitation intentional to simplify the project scope?
Could an interface be added to allow a key or name to be added to allow same-parented objects to support logging of multiple instances?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-12T02:12:51.408Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":267,"readers_count":266,"score":173.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505205,"topic_slug":"introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility","display_username":"Banks T","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27377,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"PhotonVision Lead & Developer"},"post_url":"/t/introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility/505205/2","custom_user_title":"PhotonVision Lead & Developer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3710670,"name":"Bradley Chumanov","username":"NukeMinecart","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-12T02:28:32.487Z","cooked":"

Static fields were an intentional choice, both to simplify the scope of the project and because logging a field to NetworkTables inherently is not bound to an instance. (If you have multiple entries to the same key across instances, the variable value doesn’t change across them)

It definitely is a change you get used to. It is also one of the reason why the annotation processor is provided.

Unless there is a good way to process the annotations at compile time and make them static, or easily access instance variables at runtime, then this will likely not change.

I’m curious how this works, like, for cases where you have multiple instances of the same class. For example, a class called “Swerve Module” might be used four times. How do you differentiate the logs from each module?

We’ve done a fair amount of fiddling with logs as well, and settled on the instantiation graph (we instantiate in order, e.g. “base/left-front/steer/sensor”) using class names, with optional labels (e.g. “left” and “right”), as the NT key organizer.

im my opinoin using the Units classes for unit conversion would be much better compared to using strings, aswell as in the example you showed using "m" which in my opinion would be better as meters or meter and not a single letter, other than that seems like an interesting project

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-12T06:14:16.326Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":191,"readers_count":190,"score":58.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505205,"topic_slug":"introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility","display_username":"Dan Peled","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67107,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9738 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility/505205/5","custom_user_title":"9738 Software Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3711127,"name":"Bradley Chumanov","username":"NukeMinecart","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-12T13:28:13.690Z","cooked":"

Unit conversion can be done with any string representing the unit, case insensitive (ex, “m”, “meter”, “Meters”, “M”). These names are pulled directly from the Units class, so all Units defined there work

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-12T13:28:13.690Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505205,"topic_slug":"introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility","display_username":"Bradley Chumanov","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":67107,"username":"Dan1","name":"Dan Peled","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dan1/{size}/268085_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69694,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1306 Co-President"},"post_url":"/t/introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility/505205/6","custom_user_title":"1306 Co-President","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3711323,"name":"Bradley Chumanov","username":"NukeMinecart","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-12T14:56:38.933Z","cooked":"

How do you differentiate the logs from each module?

BadgerLog doesn’t log anything, it is just a utility for NT4.
For now there is kind of a workaround for this. Any class that needs to have multiple instances of itself can implement Sendable and then call Dashboard.putSendable for each instance (with a unique key for each one)

We’ve done a fair amount of fiddling with logs as well, and settled on the instantiation graph (we instantiate in order, e.g. “base/left-front/steer/sensor”) using class names, with optional labels (e.g. “left” and “right”), as the NT key organizer.

@truher could you explain how you used the instantiation graph? It might be an option for supporting instance specific fields, but may be either slow or too complicated.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-12T14:56:38.933Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505205,"topic_slug":"introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility","display_username":"Bradley Chumanov","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":53190,"username":"truher","name":"joel truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69694,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1306 Co-President"},"post_url":"/t/introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility/505205/7","custom_user_title":"1306 Co-President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3712132,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-12T23:14:58.605Z","cooked":"

I just mean to pass some sort of logger object through the constructors. each constructor adds to the key and passes the new logger to the child constructors. it’s definitely not as brief as annotating a static. the main performance issue we’ve seen with network tables is overhead of the logging itself, nothing to do with this sort of sugar.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-13T12:02:37.618Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505205,"topic_slug":"introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility","display_username":"tjwolter - Mentor, supply clerk and chief janitor Team 5826","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28254,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/introducing-badgerlog-the-easiest-annotation-based-networktables-utility/505205/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3726001,"name":"Bradley Chumanov","username":"NukeMinecart","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T23:35:32.301Z","cooked":"

BadgerLog 2025.3 Released!

This major release of BadgerLog has several breaking changes, and some new features.

Breaking Changes

  • EntryType values have been renamed
  • Dashboard.initialize has been removed
  • Dashboard.configure is the new way to globally configure BadgerLog
  • Packages renamed and moved for more clarity
    • Delete current imports and have the IDE reimport automatically
  • The annotation processor has been removed. Warnings are now the preferred way of alerting users of an invalid entry.
    • Delete this line in build.gradle: annotationProcessor 'com.github.team1306:badger-log:2025.2.2'

New Features

  • Fields no longer have to be static to work. Instance fields are now supported
    • This is done without adding any extra methods to a class
  • Fields can have instance specific NetworkTables keys.
  • Create enum selectors
  • Automatic generation of structs from enum and record types
  • Performance impact on startup should be even less than before. (Completely removed classpath scanning!)

In addition to these features, the Javadoc and wiki have been completely rewritten from scratch to be more clear, concise, and have more examples.

The installation is a bit different than before, requiring a few extra steps. Check out installation on the wiki for more

github.com
